name: Sandals Royal Plantation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we were upgraded to the prime minister's suite because of a mixup in reservations.food excellent, room service spectacular, beach service excellent, beach somewhat small.pool small, hottub fine ,a fine boutique hotel.
reviews.title: the service and management were excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bernie and Rhoda Weintraub,NJ
reviews.title: A little disappointed, but still a great vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say I was a little disappointed in RP after reading all of the TripAdvisor reviews, which set the bar pretty high (too high, I think) for this resort. Don't get me wrong - we had an amazing trip, and I would still highly recommend RP, but the service just was not as good as I expected. There were a couple of exceptional staff members: Adrian on the beach was fantastic. My husband had a foot injury that required him to keep his foot elevated and iced down; and every day after the first day Adrian came over with a big bag of ice without even being asked. He also seemed genuinely concerned about the injury and inquired about my husband's comfort several times a day. His smile and laugh were infectious - I wish we could've brought him home. Likewise, we had the BEST waiters at Le Papillon, Jason and Jefferson. We dined with them 3 times during our 5 nights there and loved every minute of it. We talked quite a bit with Jefferson about authentic Jamaican food and drink, and he went out of his way to bring us some "Sour Sop Juice" at dinner one night for us to sample. I think we will keep in touch with him, and we really hope to see him again. Also, our butlers Damion and Winston satisfied all of our room service requests in a timely manner, although our in-room refrigerator was not re-stocked unless we specifically requested it to be.
reviews.title: Paradise Found

reviews.text: Aside from those staff members, however, we found the service to be just average; and at the Terrace restaurant, it was below average (even on "island time") the 2 times we ate dinner there. There appeared to be a miscommunication between some of the staff, as we once asked the Concierge to make dinner reservations for us, and he said "Just tell your butler to do it." Our butler had previously told us to see the Concierge. I don't need to be treated like a princess to feel like I'm getting good service; in fact, when I'm on a relaxing vacation, I'm happy with average service (and I understand that service is always on a "relaxed pace" in the islands). However, after reading the reviews on this site I expected much more and was slightly disappointed (not enough to ruin my trip, mind you!).
reviews.title: A Royal treat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also did not find the food to be particularly great, although there were a couple of fantastic dishes at Le Papillon (the Coquille appetizer and the Warm Chocolate Pudding dessert!!) and the food was much better than the normal buffet fare at other all-inclusives. I am not a foodie by any means and still was not very impressed with the food - so if you're looking for a gourmet experience, perhaps this isn't the place for you. Or you should at least eat at Le Papillon every night because the Terrace food really wasn't that great. I was also disappointed that the beach grill (advertisesd by RP as their "seasonal" third restaurant) was only open for lunch and not for dinner, even though the resort was full and the other restaurants were crowded. It would've been nice to have a "casual" dinner option.
reviews.title: Service, spoiling, pampering @ RP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third trip in the last 15 months. We enjoyed the resort on each of the first two visits, but were disappointed with our visit in March. The resort is becoming "Sandalized." it was purchased by Sandals a few years ago and the influence of Sandals is beginning to jeopardize the character of the resort. There are large posters on the beach and in the hotel advertising excursions and photos, and flat screen tv's in the lobby pitching excursions. Sandals recenlty opened their own company to control all the excursions (Island Routes) and one of the Stewart kids has been designated to run it. This company now parks two ugly large catamarans in the middle of the water just off the beach. They are all painted up like race cars and are eyesores. This is what I would expect at a Couples or another Sandals but not RP. The service has definitely slipped as well. It seems that alot of Sandals employees from other resorts have been transferred in and the service is much more like a mega- resport than a tranquil boutique resort. The slide was very disappointing as we loved this resort and were hoping to make it an annual trip. Also, despite this being our third trip there in 15 months, we were not recognized in any way - not even a thank you for coming back note from any of the managers. We found that much of the attention to detail noticed on previous trips had disappeared. they added butler service for all rooms. Unfortunately, we found the butlers to be unhelpful and slow. They always seemed to be busy welcoming new arrivals. We tipped our butler Cleon $20 to unpack our cases and we thought that beginning the stay with a nice healthy gratuity would set the stage for good butler service, but it didn't seem to have much of an effect. Dining service was painfully slow. Just a big disappointment.
reviews.title: Third time's not a charm

reviews.text: Wow! is what I am going to start out with! We traveled with 5 other couples to RP and there was not 1 disappointing thing I can think of. We have traveled to many places, all inclusives, and great hotels and there was nothing like RP to compare to.
reviews.title: An experience everyone should have in their lifetime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service and friendliness was outstanding. The word "No" was not in their vocabulary. RP planned and prepared an outstanding private beachside dinner for the 12 of us one night per my request that was out of this world. The whole "gang" truly believes that we have found the place for future trips. I have read reviews from here for over 8 months since we started planning this trip and I would have to say that some of the negative reviews that we read certainly was never seen by any of us. Santana the beach bartender was fantastic along with Adrian the beach butler. The butler service is outstanding (thanks Cleon and Tania), food is terrific. Be sure and have the Lobster BLT's. Thank you to all the staff. We will be back next year for sure!
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an absolutely gorgeous resort with great food, very attentive staff and an atmosphere of relaxed elegance.We felt pampered from the moment we arrived. Our room was on the west side, with a large patio and stunning views of the ocean.
reviews.title: Spoiled Rotten
Fantastic Evening Meal at the La Papillon Restaurant
reviews.text: The trip was perfect in every way. Our only regret was that the week passed so quickly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some things JUST GET BETTER!!! My husband and I returned from RP last week, our 5th visit. Returning to this hotel is like visiting an old friend, comfortable and easy. All of the staff is sincerely friendly, helpful and always have a smile. Sometimes when returning to a resort, one has a fear that it will not be as memorable as past visits, but here, each visit bring improvements. This time, everyone has a butler who will take care of every need...from dining reservations to specific drink requests. The beach staff has always been exceptional, and gotten BETTER. The hotel has lots of new faces but with the same great care and concern. As others have said, the food is excellent, varied and served by well trained waiters with personality and a great sense of humor, making for a truly fun fine dining experience. The beaches are not huge, but very, very pretty and well maintained. If you are looking for lots of nightlife and fun and games, don't come here. However, if you are looking for an elegant, intimate resort, ROYAL PLANTATION IS FOR YOU! Again, cudos to the management and staff.
reviews.title: Simple, STILL THE BEST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have traveled all over the Caribbean and Mexico staying at many all-inclusive resorts, but love Jamaica and in our opinion, Royal plantation is the BEST all inclusive resort on the planett!!!
reviews.title: Amazing. The perfect mellow get away. Outstanding Food & Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a perfect "get away" vacation - where you can turn off the cell phone, eat, sleep, sun and relax without a worry and without any hint of the outside world - you will love Royal Plantation. I was blown away by the quality of everything there: food, service, cleanliness. It was a perfect place to unplug. If you are looking for loud nightlife, organized or scheduled parties or activities shoved down your throat - don't stay at Royal Plantation. There are tons of things to do (from snorkeling to yoga on the pier) but it is all simply available for your pleasure - not pushed on you. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and accommodating. Like the activities and excursions at the resort: they aren't intrusive at all yet are totally available anytime you need them. The dining is out of this world from high end wine and delicious french cuisine at La Papillion (the french restaurant) to outstanding jerk chicken and tasty sandwiches at the beach side grill - every taste bud is well represented. As an "all inclusive" they truly have the five-star covered. I left my wallet in the safe in my suite and didn't hold it or cash the whole week we were there. The gym is open 24 hours and, like everything else, is immaculately clean. If you are a workout enthusiast. The spa gave a great massage and was a hidden sanctuary in a place that was already, as a whole, a perfect sanctuary. Coming home to a chilly day in New York was a harsh transition but I know we will visit Royal Plantation again. An amazing trip. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Fabulous hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! We had such a great time at the Royal Plantation. This is truly a luxury resort. I recommend going with the Royal Plan which includes everything! The dinners were incredible and the restaurants, although only two, were fairly easy to get reservations. I would still recommend booking the French restaurant upon your arrival. This resort is very small which made it very nice to get to know other travellers and the staff (whom were incredible and extremely friendly). You get a 2 butlers who are there 24hrs to assist with anything you may need. They will make your reservations, grab you a beach chair, you name it!! The rooms are extremely quiet and large. The beach is a little small and if you want lots of sun, be sure to get chairs on the peir. If you don't mind paying a little more money and like a cozy, intimate resort with great food and people, Royal Plantation is for you!
reviews.title: My stay at Royal Plantation was the worst fuc&%ing week of my life!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was just horrible....I couldn't wait to get out of there. I went to get change and the receptionist on duty was extremely rude.....I think her name was Marcia....she didn't have any change and she said it so rudely and I waited at the desk for about 15 minutes before I was acknowledged. The food was awesome though. Le Papillon restaurant was good. I had Escargos!!!! Cleon the Butler was most pleasant and helpful. Love you Cleon.
reviews.title: Great Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was December 20th, 2008 for our wedding day. It was one of the most romantic and memorable time that we have experienced . The staff was wonderful, courteous and helpful. The food was great , no complaints, the rooms emaculate, the view from our room was just breath taking. Our family was in awe when they saw the beauty of this hotel. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: The best getaway that was romantic, luxurious and tranquil

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 night stay at Royal Plantation, and in a word, they made us feel - Royal. Once our car arrived from the airport our Butler Ralston greeted us with a smile -- and the Five Star service began (our other Butler Jermaine also fabulous). It was late but he escorted us and our bags (bags were there immediately, I don't even know how they got them up there) to our beautiful suite, and then got us a table right away for dinner.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay at Royal Plantation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without listing every detail, I can make this really simple, everything was fabulous. The bed: wonderful and VERY comfortable. The Suite (1 Bdrm Oceanfront Honeymoon): beautiful. Beach: small but beautiful, and they're always out there manicuring it. Food: excellent, fruit and "Healthy Muffin" in the morning were superb, full breakfast was available. We never tired of the meals or the food choices. Oh and lunch and drinks on the beach? No Problem. Andre was there with a smile taking care of everyone.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pictures of the hotel online are very realistic. The only things they don't show on their website are the gorgeous grounds, exotic peacocks that are roaming around, the beautiful store, spa and gym on property. The grounds are stunning. While going on some excursions outside of the hotel (more on that later) our drivers would always pick up guests at other hotels. Let me tell you, pulling into those properties was NOTHING like driving up to the Royal Plantation. Everything from the design of the buildings to the perfectly manicured grass, gorgeous.
reviews.title: The best vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing - the Butler encouraged us to go on planned excursions with a particular touring company -- we found it just as easy to take a cab to those excursions on our own -- no waiting for/picking up from other hotels. We did the Dunns River Falls, Majestic Mountain zip lining/bobsledding, and Martha Brae rafting. All great but wouldn't do the rafts again, too long of a drive (even though our Butler said it's 20-30 mins away/was actually an hour and a half drive) and it wasn't that great. Would have lounged at the Beach all day but, there were clouds and rain every day. I've never seen such cloudy weather in the Caribbean. But at this hotel, it was like no one cared, they were in such a great place, just relaxing and being taken care of.
reviews.title: A little peace of heaven!

description: •All suite resort and all are serviced by butlers trained by the Guild of Professional English Butlers•2 private beaches with beach butler service•The Caribbean’s only Champagne and Caviar Bar•Exquisite International, Mediterranean, Caribbean and French cuisine•24 hour in suite dining•Complimentary transfers from this resort to all Sandals Resorts•Voted Sandals Resorts “World Leading All-Inclusive Company” 16 years in a row•Voted Sandals Resorts “Caribbean’s Leading Hotel Brand” 18 years in a row•Five Star Diamond Award - American Academy of Hospitality Sciences
